questions.question_text:
You have an Azure Virtual Desktop host pool that contains 20 Windows 10 Enterprise multi-session hosts.
Users connect to the Azure Virtual Desktop deployment from computers that run Windows 10.
You plan to implement FSLogix Application Masking.
You need to deploy Application Masking rule sets. The solution must minimize administrative effort.
To where should you copy the rule sets?

choices.C: C:\Program Files\FSLogix\Apps\Rules on every session host
choices.A: the FSLogix profile container of each user
choices.B: C:\Program Files\FSLogix\Apps\Rules on every Windows 10 computer

discussion.content: Correct https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/fslogix/application-masking-rules-ht#deploying-rule-sets
Correct

Selected Answer: C
To deploy FSLogix Application Masking rule sets with minimal administrative effort, you should copy the rule sets to C:\Program Files\FSLogix\Apps\Rules on every session host. This ensures that the rules are applied consistently across all session hosts in your Azure Virtual Desktop environment.

So, the correct answer is C. C:\Program Files\FSLogix\Apps\Rules on every session host.
Correct, can all the questions be this easy :)

Selected Answer: C
C. C:\Program Files\FSLogix\Apps\Rules on every session host
yes its c

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct. Done it in LAB.

Selected Answer: C
This question appeared in the exam I took today.
C is correct Answer

Selected Answer: C
C is correct answer. 

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/fslogix/application-masking-rules-ht#deploying-rule-sets

comments.content:
Storage Type: NetApps
Registry Key: VHDlocations

If cost is no issue, NetApps offers better performance. VHDLocations is needed unless Cloud Cache is implemented, but it doesn't have to be implemented just because the users are cloud-only.
CCDLocation is made if you want to store the profile in cloud cach, and if you want to configure it like that you also need to use page blob storage

discussion.content:
Storage Type: Azure Files
FSLogix Registry Key: CCDLocations

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft Entra tenant named contoso.com that contains cloud-only user accounts.

You have an Azure Virtual Desktop deployment that contains a host pool named Pool1. Pool1 contains session hosts that are joined to contoso.com.

You plan to use FSLogix profile containers to manage user profiles.

You need to configure storage for the FSLogix solution.

Which type of storage should you use for the profile containers, and which FSLogix registry key should you configure? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

comments.content: No, that answer is incorrect and could confuse people. Microsoft recommends that external users be licensed in a separate subscription as a best practice. You would be right if it weren’t for the fact that option D includes the following: "Add a new host pool." With this, you would no longer have access to app1 because it would be in the other host pool, which automatically eliminates option D. However, I insist that the part about creating a new subscription for external users is correct.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
New subscription is needed to activate per-user licensing

Selected Answer: D
The per-user license need to be configured at the subscription level. The subscription is already having users with E5 license so you will need to create another subscription.

Selected Answer: A
To meet the requirements of licensing Fabrikam users with Per-user access pricing and ensuring that App1 is accessible to both internal and Fabrikam users while minimizing costs, you should first add the Fabrikam users to the application group that contains App1. This step ensures that the users have access to the application.

So, the correct answer is:

A. Add the Fabrikam users to the application group that contains App1

Correct Answer is A
To meet all the requirements, including minimizing costs, add the Fabrikam users to the application group that contains App1. This will provide them access through per-user access pricing without incurring additional license or infrastructure costs.

Selected Answer: A
answer is A

Selected Answer: A
According to Copilot:
First thing you should do is A. Add the Fabrikam users to the application group that contains App1.
By doing this, you can then configure the necessary licensing for the Fabrikam users under per-user access pricing. This approach ensures that both internal and external users can access App1 without creating new host pools or increasing unnecessary costs.

choices.B: Add a new host pool to Sub1.
choices.C: Assign a Microsoft 365 F3 license to each Fabrikam user.
choices.A: Add the Fabrikam users to the application group that contains App1.
choices.D: Add a new host pool to a new subscription.

questions.question_text:
You have an Azure subscription named Sub1 and a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

The tenant contains user accounts for all internal users and users from a partner company named Fabrikam, Inc. Each internal user is assigned a Microsoft 365 E5 license. The users at Fabrikam are not assigned any licenses.

Sub1 has an Azure Virtual Desktop deployment that contains a host pool named Pool1. Pool1 contains a RemoteApp named App1.

You need to configure access to App1. The solution must meet the following requirements:

• The Fabrikam users must be licensed by using Per-user access pricing.
• App1 must be accessible to all the internal and Fabrikam users.
• Costs must be minimized.

What should you do first?

You have an Azure Virtual Desktop deployment that contains the host pools shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You plan to use app attach.

In which host pools can the session hosts use app attach?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A 
Your session hosts need to run a supported Windows client operating system and at least one of them must be powered on. Windows Server isn't supported.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/app-attach-setup?tabs=portal&pivots=app-attach

comments.content: I take this back, App attach is not supported on Win10 Pro. For this reason, I now think only Pool1 and Pool2 are the correct answers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
This question is very ambiguous. It says to "use" app attach. App attach can be used with Win10, Win11, or Server 2016 - 2022. You can, however, only create MSIX images using Win10 or Win11. But it says "use" not create an app attach image. For this reason, I say E, all the Pools.

Selected Answer: D
Prerequisites
Before you can create an MSIX image, you need the following things:
- Download the MSIXMGR tool and extract it to a folder.
- Administrative permissions on a Windows 10 or Windows 11 device to create the MSIX image.
- An MSIX-packaged application (.msix file) you want to use with Azure Virtual Desktop.
Source: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/app-attach-create-msix-image?tabs=cim&WT.mc_id=studentamb_232547#prerequisites

Selected Answer: A
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/app-attach-create-msix-image?tabs=cim#prerequisites

A
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/app-attach-create-msix-image?tabs=cim#prerequisites

Selected Answer: A
It should be A.
It is not supported with W10 pro and Server.

questions.question_text:
You have an Azure Virtual Desktop deployment that contains a host pool named Pool1.

Pool1 contains two session hosts that are Microsoft Entra joined.

You need to configure single sign-on (SSO) to connect to the session hosts. The solution must enable Microsoft Entra authentication for Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) in the Microsoft Entra tenant.

Which application requires that you modify the remoteDesktopSecurityConfiguration object?

choices.B: Microsoft Azure Windows Virtual Machine Sign-in

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
To configure single sign-on (SSO) for your Azure Virtual Desktop deployment and enable Microsoft Entra authentication for Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP), you need to modify the remoteDesktopSecurityConfiguration object for the Windows Cloud Login application. This application is used to enable Microsoft Entra authentication for RDP.

So, the correct answer is:

A. Windows Cloud Login

Correct 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/configure-single-sign-on#enable-microsoft-entra-authentication-for-rdp
